docstring.long_description:
Compatible with National Instruments devices that utilize NI-DAQmx. The device must have a analog accelerometer input channel.
Tested with a simulated NI-9234 module.

This instrument will likely only be compatible with Windows systems due to
NI driver availablity. To use the instrument you must install the runtime:

https://www.ni.com/en/support/downloads/drivers/download.ni-daq-mx.html
docstring.short_description: Creates a task with (a) channel(s) that use an accelerometer to measure acceleration.

parameters.name: cDAQ_start_channel
parameters.description: The device and channel to read from.

parameters.name: cDAQ_end_channel
parameters.description: To read from only one channel, set this to the same as cDAQ_start_channel. To read from multiple channels, set this to the last channel you want to read from.

parameters.name: min_val
parameters.description: Specifies in **units** the minimum value you expect to measure.

parameters.name: max_val
parameters.description: Specifies in **units** the maximum value you expect to measure.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: The units to use to return accelerometer measurements.

parameters.name: sensitivity
parameters.description: Is the sensitivity of the sensor. This value is in the units you specify with the sensitivity_units input. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.

parameters.name: sensitivity_units
parameters.description: Specifies the units of the sensitivity input.

parameters.name: current_excitation_value
parameters.description: Specifies in amperes the amount of excitation to supply to the sensor. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.
